byline.contributor: Mitch Smith reported from Chicago, and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from New York.
byline.original: By MITCH SMITH and RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr

abstract: Cuyahoga County Sheriff's Dept issues report giving new details about fatal shooting of 12-year-old Tamir Rice by Cleveland Police Officer Tim Loehmann, including apparent lack of witness testimony that any warnings were given before shots were fired; report makes no recommendations on charges, and county prosecutor Timothy J. McGinty has said he will allow grand jury to decide on a possible indictment.
lead_paragraph: A lengthy report by the Cuyahoga County Sheriff’s Department does not answer whether a Cleveland police officer issued a warning before firing on the 12-year-old boy.

headline.main: Sheriff’s Report Provides New Details on Tamir Rice’s Death, but Leaves Questions
headline.print_headline: Sheriff’s Report Provides New Details on Tamir Rice’s Death, but Leaves Questions

snippet: A lengthy report by the Cuyahoga County Sheriff’s Department does not answer whether a Cleveland police officer issued a warning before firing on the 12-year-old boy.
